result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Violation: 2 Cts-Disorderly Conduct; Battery; Criminal Damage to Property; Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500); Operate Firearm While Intoxicated; Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon. Iss. Agency: Monroe Police Dept.
May not possess or consume any intoxicants.  May not possess any firearms.   No violent or abusive or disorderly contact with: :J.L.   May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold.

Pre-trial conference on June 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:06 AM Defendant Brian Scott Lafferty appeared by video with Attorney Lindsay L Erickson appeared by video.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court in person for State of Wisconsin. State complied with Victim Witness Notification.  Court asks Atty Erickson to file a signed copy of the WOPH and waiver of appearance.  In further effort to accommodate the party's travel today, the court will hold a colloquay with Mr Lafferty as to waiver of PH and waiver of appearance today.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial.  Information filed.  Court advises defendant of same charges & penalties. Atty Erickson clarifies on the record as to one felony count in this matter as cited and based on the complaint.    Not Guilty plea entered on all counts.

May not possess or consume any intoxicants.  May not possess any firearms.   NO CONTACT WITH:J.L. or residence. May go to the residence one time to pick up personal belongings if accompanied by an officer or upon stipulation by the parties for counsel to retrieval of personal property and accompanied by a 3rd party.
